security_audit.summary: This skill consists entirely of documentation and TypeScript/React templates for creating custom workflow nodes. No network calls, file I/O beyond imports, command execution, or environment variable access were detected. All code follows standard FlowGram patterns and is safe for users.

content.user_title: Create custom workflow nodes in FlowGram
content.value_statement: Creating custom nodes for FlowGram workflows requires understanding complex data structures and form configurations. This skill provides ready-to-use templates and step-by-step guidance for building both simple auto-form nodes and complex custom UI nodes.
actual_capabilities: Generate simple node templates with automatic form rendering from JSON Schema
Generate complex node templates with custom React form components
Define node inputs, outputs, and form field configurations
Register new node types in FlowGram workflow system
Use built-in components like PromptEditorWithVariables and VariableSelector
Follow best practices for single-responsibility node design
limitations: Works only with FlowGram demo-free-layout project structure
Does not execute or test created nodes automatically
Requires manual copying of template files to project directory
Does not generate node execution logic (runtime behavior)

best_practices: Use JSON Schema with clear descriptions and validation rules for all form fields
Define required fields in the schema to prevent incomplete node configurations
Handle readonly state in custom components for non-editable workflow views
anti_patterns: Do not manually manage form state when Field component binding is available
Do not skip the required array in schema definitions for essential fields
Do not mix simple node templates when custom UI layouts are needed

faq.question: What is the difference between simple and complex nodes?
faq.answer: Simple nodes use automatic form generation from JSON Schema. Complex nodes use custom React components for full UI control.

faq.question: Where should I copy the generated template files?
faq.answer: Copy to apps/demo-free-layout/src/nodes/{node-name}/ directory for each new custom node.

faq.question: Does this skill execute the created node code?
faq.answer: No. This skill only generates template files. You must run rush dev:demo-free-layout to test the node.

faq.question: What icons are supported for custom nodes?
faq.answer: SVG, JPG, and PNG formats are supported. Place icons in apps/demo-free-layout/src/assets/ with naming convention icon-{node-name}.svg

faq.question: How do I use variable references in form fields?
faq.answer: Set field type to 'template' in inputsValues and use formComponent: 'prompt-editor' in inputs schema for variable-aware fields.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with fixed-layout projects?
faq.answer: This skill targets demo-free-layout. Fixed-layout projects may have different node registration patterns. Check project documentation.
